snippet.title: Apple vs. Greenlight: deconstructing the battle over preferred stock
snippet.description: ..."Mo Money Mo Problems," in the immortal words of Notorious B.I.G.Apple has more money than many nations, so it's only natural to expect the $137 billion cash and investment hoard to attract some controversy. Maybe even a few lawsuits.That's exactly what happened earlier this month. Hedge fund manager and billionaire David Einhorn, who runs the market-beating Greenlight Capital...

snippet.title: It's personal: many gamers prefer local multiplayer to online
snippet.description: ...As Sean "Puff Daddy" Combs so eloquently put it a few years ago when hawking Xbox Live, "It's good to play together." After all, one of the very first video games, 1958's Tennis for Two, was designed with multiplayer in mind. Four decades later and the legacy lives on: gaming is better when played with others. To that end, we have options: Try and schedule a session...

snippet.title: Facebook users prefer profiles over newfangled(ish) newsfeed
snippet.description: ...Since Facebook has become a pretty serious mainstay of social media, researchers have become interested in using it to find out which types of social interaction people prefer.
